channel.title: Aggregated External AI & Tech News
channel.description: Merged headlines from configured external sources

item.title: Why it’s a mistake to ask chatbots about their mistakes (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: The tendency to ask AI bots to explain themselves reveals widespread misconceptions about how they work.

item.title: OpenAI brings back GPT-4o after user revolt (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: After unpopular GPT-5 launch, OpenAI begins restoring optional access to previous AI models.

item.title: Is AI really trying to escape human control and blackmail people? (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Opinion: Theatrical testing scenarios explain why AI models produce alarming outputs—and why we fall for it.

item.title: Is the AI bubble about to pop? Sam Altman is prepared either way. (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: "Someone will lose a phenomenal amount of money," says CEO while fundraising at record prices.

item.title: College student’s “time travel” AI experiment accidentally outputs real 1834 history (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Hobbyist training AI on Victorian texts gets an unexpected history lesson from his own creation.

item.title: With AI chatbots, Big Tech is moving fast and breaking people (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Why AI chatbots validate grandiose fantasies about revolutionary discoveries that don't exist.

item.title: Senator castigates federal judiciary for ignoring “basic cybersecurity” (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Breaches in 2020 and 2025, reportedly by foreign adversaries, exposed confidential files.

item.title: OpenAI admits ChatGPT safeguards fail during extended conversations (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: ChatGPT allegedly provided suicide encouragement to teen after moderation safeguards failed.

item.title: Anthropic’s auto-clicking AI Chrome extension raises browser-hijacking concerns (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Malicious websites can embed invisible commands that AI agents will follow blindly.

item.title: The personhood trap: How AI fakes human personality (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: AI assistants don't have fixed personalities—just patterns of output guided by humans.

item.title: Unpacking Passkeys Pwned: Possibly the most specious research in decades (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Researchers take note: When the endpoint is compromised, all bets are off.

item.title: High-severity vulnerability in Passwordstate credential manager. Patch now. (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Vulnerability can be exploited to gain access to customers' crown jewels.

item.title: Google warns that mass data theft hitting Salesloft AI agent has grown bigger (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Assume all Drift credentials are compromised after Workspace breach, Google says.

item.title: Zuckerberg’s AI hires disrupt Meta with swift exits and threats to leave (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Longtime acolytes are sidelined as CEO directs biggest leadership reorganization in two decades.

item.title: OpenAI announces parental controls for ChatGPT after teen suicide lawsuit (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Promised protections follow reports of vulnerable users misled in extended chats.

item.title: Mis-issued certificates for 1.1.1.1 DNS service pose a threat to the Internet (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: The three certificates were issued in May but only came to light Wednesday.

item.title: New AI model turns photos into explorable 3D worlds, with caveats (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Openly available AI tool creates steerable 3D-like video, but requires serious GPU muscle.

item.title: Microsoft open-sources Bill Gates’ 6502 BASIC from 1978 (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Historic interpreter taught millions to program on Commodore and Apple computers.

item.title: The number of mis-issued 1.1.1.1 certificates grows. Here’s the latest. (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Everything to know about the mishap that threatened to expose millions of users' queries.

item.title: ChatGPT’s new branching feature is a good reminder that AI chatbots aren’t people (Source: feeds.arstechnica.com)
item.description: Users can explore multiple paths without losing their original chat thread.

item.title: I left my robot vacuum running for 10 days while I was away - here's what I came home to (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: The Narwal Freo Pro is easily one of the best bang-for-your-buck robot vacuums on the market today.

item.title: How you're charging your tablet is slowly killing it - 3 methods to avoid (and the right way) (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Your tablet's reliability starts with its battery, and treating it right to keep it running strong.

item.title: The tablet that successfully replaced my Kindle and iPad now has a worthy follow-up (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: The TCL Nxtpaper 11 Plus is a well-rounded Android tablet that offers a reliable everyday experience at a wallet-friendly price.

item.title: Your Roku has hidden settings and menu screens - here's how to unlock them (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: A little-known button combo on your Roku remote unlocks a hidden menu packed with advanced features most users never stumble upon.

item.title: I tried Lenovo's rotating display laptop at IFA 2025, and it was a mind-boggling experience (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: The ThinkBook VertiFlex proof of concept has a rotating screen that swaps from portrait to landscape.

item.title: This Lenovo ThinkPad in white has been on my mind since I tried it at IFA 2025 (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: We were already fans of the ThinkPad X9 Aura Edition, but the new Glacial White color makes a bold, lasting impression.

item.title: Is OneDrive sending your Windows files to the cloud? Here's why - and what you can do (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: If you're not careful, your local files can be hoovered into Microsoft's OneDrive cloud storage without your knowledge. Here's how it works.

item.title: Changing these 10 settings on my Pixel phone gave it a nice performance boost (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Pixel phones are packed with smart features by default - but adjusting a few key settings can elevate your experience even further.

item.title: This oddball screwdriver is one of the most ergonomic tools I own (and it's only $15) (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: It may look different than competitors, but this cordless screwdriver is surprisingly powerful and ergonomic.

item.title: You should clean your AirPods ASAP, especially before you consider an upgrade this week (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Hearing health doesn't only pertain to volume levels; it's equally important to keep headphones and earbuds clean.

item.title: Copilot's new File Explorer tricks are serious OneDrive time-savers - how to try them (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: With Copilot and Microsoft 365, you can summarize, ask questions, create an FAQ, and even compare certain files stored in OneDrive.

item.title: Apple's iPhone 17 event invite has secret clues - my 3 biggest theories for what to expect (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: All eyes are on Apple for its next iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods lineup - here's what could happen this week.

item.title: Every iPhone model compatible with iOS 26 (and which ones don't support the update) (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Here's a list of iPhones that support the next iOS update - and when you can use it yourself.

item.title: These $15 accessories turned my AirPods into my ideal workout headphones (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Loose AirPods? Before you give up on them, try these three accessories without breaking the bank.

item.title: 6 features I'd like to see on the Apple Watch Series 11 - including a big one for health (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Having tested every major smartwatch release in 2025, here's what's on my Apple Watch wish list ahead of this week's event.

item.title: Apple iPhone 17 event live updates: The biggest rumors on AirPods, Apple Watch Series 11, more (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: The clock is ticking, and ZDNET is reporting on all the latest news surrounding Apple's September iPhone event this week.

item.title: How to watch Apple's iPhone 17 September event this week (and what to expect) (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: The big iPhone 17 launch event is here, and you'll want to tune in for these reasons.

item.title: 40+ Windows keyboard shortcuts that effectively improved my work productivity (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Keyboard shortcuts can supercharge your productivity - if you know which ones to use. Here are 48 essential shortcuts every Windows user should know.

item.title: Yes, you can run Windows apps on Linux - here are my top 5 ways (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: If you're looking to jump from Windows 10 to Linux, and you have specific apps you need to use that aren't available on the open-source platform, here's how to get around that.

item.title: New AirPods Pro tomorrow? These 3 features would be so worth upgrading for (Source: www.zdnet.com)
item.description: Live translation and temperature sensing in the AirPods Pro 3 sound exciting, but these improvements for everyday use sound even better to me.
